entries.title: President Trump has signed a sweeping travel ban on 12 countries and introduced more-limited travel restrictions on seven others
President Trump ordered an investigation into Joe Biden’s actions as president, including his use of an autopen, alleging aides concealed his cognitive decline
The Trump administration is redirecting a key antidrone technology earmarked for Ukraine to American forces
Deep job cuts at the Education Department have stacked up cases alleging civil-rights violations in U.S. schools
A federal judge ruled Wednesday that the Trump administration must allow migrants it shipped to a notorious Salvadoran prison an opportunity to challenge their removal from the U.S.
President Trump is losing patience with Elon Musk after the billionaire attacked Republicans’ sprawling tax-and-spending bill
Passing the GOP’s tax bill in its current form would push 10.9 million people out of Medicaid or other forms of health coverage by 2034, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said Wednesday

Former White House cost-cutting czar Elon Musk called President Trump’s “big, beautiful” tax and spending package a “disgusting abomination”
Some of Trump’s biggest inaugural donors benefit from early government actions

The White House is sending Congress a $9.4 billion rescissions package Tuesday that would codify some spending cuts made by the Trump administration, effectively having lawmakers reverse spending they previously voted into law
David Hogg has a plan to revitalize the moribund Democratic brand: get rid of some of the party’s oldest lawmakers. More than a few party leaders aren’t pleased.
President Trump and Elon Musk praised each other at a farewell news conference as the billionaire returns to the private sector though Trump said Musk would continue advising him
President Trump is at risk of shrinking the Republican coalition that he broadened to win the 2024 election
Top donors to a committee supporting events celebrating America’s 250th birthday will receive special access to a military parade and other festivities
President Trump’s political team commissioned a poll that showed Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene losing a potential race for Senate in Georgia by double-digits
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth vowed that there would be “devastating consequences” should China seek to “conquer” Taiwan
Intelligence staffer Nathan Vilas Laatsch charged with seeking to pass classified documents to foreign government
The ambitious plan for a new U.S. missile-defense shield known as Golden Dome needs to navigate technology hurdles and budget questions
More than 100 National Security Council officials have been removed from their roles or detailed back to their agencies, part of a broader restructuring process
Douglas Edelman, one of the U.S.’s largest known tax evaders, pleaded guilty to tax crimes and defrauding the government
